intro: Carex quichensis, commonly known as the Quiché sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to high-altitude regions of Central America, particularly in Guatemala and Mexico. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with slender, cylindrical stems and dense clusters of spikelets. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in cloud forests or mountainous habitats. Carex quichensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
